skill.name: technical-analysis
skill.description: Technical analysis capabilities for APIs, data models, integrations, and security requirements. Use when analyzing technical aspects of systems or documenting technical requirements.
skill.summary: Technical analysis capabilities for APIs, data models, integrations, and security requirements. Use ...
skill.author: DoubleslashSE

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with markdown templates for technical analysis. Contains no executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access, and no command execution. This is a prompt-based guidance skill only.

content.value_statement: Technical systems like APIs and data models are hard to document consistently. This skill provides standardized templates for documenting REST APIs, GraphQL schemas, data models, integrations, and security requirements.
actual_capabilities: Document REST API endpoints with request/response schemas
Analyze GraphQL queries, mutations, and types
Create data entity documentation with relationships
Document security requirements and compliance controls
Generate infrastructure overviews with compute and storage details
limitations: Does not execute code or interact with live systems
Does not perform automated security scanning
Requires user to provide system information to document

use_cases.title: Document system architecture
use_cases.description: Create consistent API documentation and data model specifications for new projects.

use_cases.title: Map integration requirements
use_cases.description: Document integration points between systems and define data flow requirements.

use_cases.title: Assess security posture
use_cases.description: Document authentication, authorization, and compliance requirements for audits.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze REST API
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the technical-analysis skill to document this API endpoint: [describe endpoint, methods, and purpose]

prompt_templates.title: Map data entities
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the technical-analysis skill to create entity documentation for [entity name] including attributes, relationships, and constraints.

prompt_templates.title: Document integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the technical-analysis skill to document the integration between [system A] and [system B] including protocol, authentication, and data flow.

prompt_templates.title: Assess security
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the technical-analysis skill to document security requirements for [system or feature] including authentication, authorization, and data protection.

output_examples.input: Document a REST API endpoint for creating user accounts
output: **Purpose**: Create a new user account in the system
**Business Rules**: Email must be unique, password minimum 8 characters

best_practices: Use consistent template formats across all API documentation for readability
Include business rules and constraints alongside technical specifications
Document error responses and retry logic for integration points
anti_patterns: Skipping authentication and authorization documentation for endpoints
Documenting only success cases without error handling scenarios
Leaving placeholder values without actual system details

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use it whenever you need to document technical systems.

faq.question: What formats can it document?
faq.answer: It documents REST APIs, GraphQL schemas, message queues, databases, and file-based integrations.

faq.question: Does it connect to real systems?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides templates. You provide the system details and it formats the documentation.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a prompt-based skill with no network access or file system changes. Data stays in your session.

faq.question: Why are my documentation results empty?
faq.answer: The skill needs you to describe the system details first. Provide endpoint definitions, entity names, or integration specifications.

faq.question: How is this different from Swagger/OpenAPI?
faq.answer: This skill creates human-readable documentation with business context. Swagger defines machine-readable API contracts. Use both together.
